episodeTitle: A Hex on Luffy! Colors Trap!
episodeTitleJapanese: ルフィを襲う魔力！カラーズトラップ
description: Luffy attempts to rescue Zoro, Nami, and Vivi from Mr. 3's deadly wax trap, but inadvertently speeds up the waxing process. Miss Goldenweek reveals her hypnotic Colors Trap ability, using painted symbols to control Luffy's actions and emotions, preventing him from saving his friends. Usopp must find a way to break the spell before everyone is encased in wax.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi First Use
events.description: Luffy debuts the Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi (Gum-Gum Hammer) technique while fighting Mr. 3. He uses the wax stuck to his feet as a makeshift hammer, turning Mr. 3's own weapon against him by smashing through the agent's defenses.
events.significance: First appearance of this signature Luffy technique, demonstrating his creativity in using his rubber powers and his ability to adapt enemy attacks to his advantage.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first use of this hammer technique using wax as a weapon

events.title: Luffy Breaks Through Candle Wall
events.description: Using the wax stuck to his hands and feet as hammers, Luffy smashes through Mr. 3's Candle Wall defense, sending the Baroque Works agent flying and demonstrating the effectiveness of using Mr. 3's own powers against him.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's combat ingenuity and marks a turning point in the battle against Mr. 3, though the victory is short-lived due to Miss Goldenweek's interference.

events.title: Miss Goldenweek's Colors Trap Revealed
events.description: Miss Goldenweek reveals her Colors Trap ability for the first time, using paint-based symbols to hypnotize and control people's emotions and actions. She demonstrates this by preventing Luffy from destroying the Giant Candle Service Set, despite his intentions to save his friends.
events.significance: First appearance of Miss Goldenweek's unique non-Devil Fruit ability, introducing a psychological combat technique rarely seen in One Piece. Establishes her as a significant threat despite her young age and lack of physical power.

quotes.speaker: Miss Goldenweek
quotes.context: Revealing her hypnotic ability for the first time

events.title: Uragiri no Kuro (Black of Betrayal) Debut
events.description: Miss Goldenweek uses Uragiri no Kuro (Black of Betrayal), painting a black symbol that causes Luffy to betray his friends and refuse to help them, doing the exact opposite of what they ask him to do.
events.significance: First demonstration of a specific Colors Trap technique, showing the dangerous versatility of Miss Goldenweek's ability to manipulate emotions and loyalty.

events.title: Warai no Kiiro (Yellow of Laughter) Debut
events.description: Miss Goldenweek paints Warai no Kiiro (Yellow of Laughter) on Luffy's back, causing him to burst into uncontrollable laughter and making him unable to take the dire situation seriously despite his friends being in mortal danger.
events.significance: Demonstrates another Colors Trap variant, showing how Miss Goldenweek can completely manipulate emotions to incapacitate opponents without physical combat.

events.title: Togyu no Aka (Red of Bullfighting) Debut
events.description: Miss Goldenweek uses Togyu no Aka (Red of Bullfighting), painting a red target that causes Luffy to attack it mindlessly like a bull charging at a matador's cape, directing all his attacks away from saving his friends.
events.significance: Shows another facet of Colors Trap's versatility in controlling not just emotions but also directing physical actions and combat focus.

events.title: Kanashimi no Ao (Blue of Sadness) Debut
events.description: Miss Goldenweek paints Kanashimi no Ao (Blue of Sadness) on Luffy, causing him to become melancholic and depressed, stripping away his characteristic enthusiasm and fighting spirit.
events.significance: Demonstrates the emotional range of Colors Trap, showing it can induce negative emotions that completely neutralize Luffy's normally indomitable will.

events.title: Nagomi no Midori (Green of Soothing) Debut
events.description: Miss Goldenweek combines her yellow and blue paints to create Nagomi no Midori (Green of Soothing), causing Luffy to become extremely calm and relaxed. Under this spell, Luffy sits down for a peaceful tea party with Miss Goldenweek instead of fighting.
events.significance: Shows that Miss Goldenweek can combine different Colors Trap effects and demonstrates the complete pacifying effect her abilities can have on even the most determined opponents.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Under the spell of Nagomi no Midori, having a tea party instead of fighting

events.title: Usopp Fights Alone Against Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine
events.description: While Luffy is incapacitated by Colors Trap, Usopp must face Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine alone to protect Karoo and buy time. Despite being terrified and outmatched, Usopp stands his ground, showing his growth as a warrior.
events.significance: Important character development moment for Usopp, showing him stepping up when his crew needs him most, even when facing overwhelming odds without Luffy's protection.

events.title: Mr. 5's Nose Fancy Double Cannon
events.description: Mr. 5 demonstrates his Nose Fancy Double Cannon technique, firing explosive boogers from both nostrils simultaneously at Usopp and Karoo, creating a more powerful explosive attack.
events.significance: Shows Mr. 5's ability to escalate his explosive attacks, adding variety to his Bomu Bomu no Mi Devil Fruit abilities.

events.title: Vivi, Zoro, and Nami Nearly Fully Encased
events.description: The wax from Mr. 3's Giant Candle Service Set continues to rise, nearly completely covering Vivi, Zoro, and Nami. They can barely move or speak as the deadly wax hardens around them, bringing them dangerously close to death.
events.significance: Raises the stakes dramatically, creating a time-sensitive crisis that demonstrates the real danger of Mr. 3's abilities and the helplessness of even strong fighters like Zoro against certain Devil Fruit powers.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: First use of the Tonkachi technique

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Under the spell of Nagomi no Midori, having a tea party with Miss Goldenweek

themes.description: The episode explores how psychological attacks can be more effective than physical power, as Miss Goldenweek's non-Devil Fruit ability completely neutralizes Luffy despite his superior combat strength.
themes.symbolism: The various colors represent different psychological states, showing how easily the mind can be manipulated through external stimuli.
culturalReferences: Color psychology theory is referenced through Miss Goldenweek's abilities

themes.theme: Courage in the Face of Fear
themes.description: Usopp must stand alone against powerful enemies while Luffy is incapacitated, showing that true courage means fighting even when afraid and outmatched.
themes.symbolism: Usopp's solo stand represents his growth from coward to warrior, foreshadowing his later development.

themes.description: The episode highlights how the crew depends on each other, as Luffy's incapacitation forces Usopp to step up, while Zoro, Nami, and Vivi are completely helpless without rescue.
themes.symbolism: The wax trap physically demonstrates how individual crew members cannot always save themselves and must rely on their nakama.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows his combat creativity by using Mr. 3's wax as a weapon, but also reveals his vulnerability to psychological attacks due to his simple-minded nature.
keyActions: Uses Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi with wax hammers
Falls victim to multiple Colors Trap techniques
Has a peaceful tea party while his friends are dying

characterSpotlights.development: Reveals herself as a major threat despite lacking Devil Fruit powers or physical strength, using psychological warfare to completely neutralize the strongest enemy.
keyActions: Uses Uragiri no Kuro to make Luffy betray his friends
Uses Warai no Kiiro to make Luffy laugh uncontrollably
Uses Togyu no Aka to redirect Luffy's attacks
Uses Kanashimi no Ao to make Luffy depressed
Uses Nagomi no Midori to pacify Luffy completely

characterSpotlights.role: Secondary protagonist and last line of defense
characterSpotlights.development: Forced to face dangerous enemies alone, showing growth in courage and responsibility despite his fear.
keyActions: Faces Mr. 5 and Miss Valentine alone
Protects Karoo while Luffy is incapacitated
Attempts to break Luffy free from Colors Trap

mangaDifferences.difference: In the anime, when Luffy readies his attack to destroy the Giant Candle Service Set, he uses Brogy's helmet spike to spin around, making Brogy dizzy. In the manga, Luffy used a wax dagger instead, causing Brogy to bleed and scream in pain.

trivia.fact: Miss Goldenweek's Colors Trap is NOT a Devil Fruit ability, but rather a skill based on color psychology and hypnosis through painted symbols.
This episode adapts Chapters 123 and 124 from the manga, with Chapter 124 being titled 'This Tea is Really Delicious,' referencing Luffy's tea party scene under Nagomi no Midori's influence.
The Gomu Gomu no Tonkachi technique debuted in this episode would become one of Luffy's signature moves, used frequently throughout the series.
According to Oda in the SBS, Miss Goldenweek's ability works through color psychology, and people with simple minds like Luffy are more vulnerable to it.
